content: बुद्धिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [बुध्-क्तिन्] {@--1@} Perception, comprehension. {@--2@} Intellect, understanding, intelligence, talent; तीक्ष्णा नारुंतुदा बुद्धिः <ls>Śi. 2. 109</ls>; शास्त्रेष्वकुंठिता बुद्धिः <ls>R. 1. 19.</ls> {@--3@} Information, knowledge; बुद्धिर्यस्य बलं तस्य <ls>H. 2. 122</ls> ‘knowledge is power’; <ls>P. I. 4. 52.</ls> {@--4@} Discrimination, judgment, discernment. {@--5@} Mind; मूढः परप्रत्ययनेयबुद्धिः <ls>M. 1.</ls> <ls n="M.">2</ls>; so कृपण°, पाप° &c. {@--6@} Presence of mind, readiness of wit. {@--7@} An impression, opinion, belief, idea, feeling; दूरात्तमवलोक्य व्याघ्रबुद्ध्या पलायंते <ls>H. 3</ls>; अनया बुद्ध्या <ls>Mu. 1</ls> ‘in this belief’; अनुक्रोशबुद्ध्या <ls>Me. 115.</ls> {@--8@} Intention, purpose, design; <ls>Ku. 4. 45.</ls> (बुद्ध्या ‘intentionally,’ ‘purposely,’ ‘deliberately’). {@--9@} Returning to consciousness, recovery from a swoon; <ls>Māl. 4. 10.</ls> {@--10@} (In Sān. <ab>phil.</ab>) Intellect, the second of the 25 elements of the Sāṃkhyas.
